intro: Myosotis gallica, commonly known as the European forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and northwestern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring slender stems and basal leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, sky-blue or white flowers with five petals, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its flowers are characterized by a distinctive dark purple or brown spot at the base of each petal. Myosotis gallica is often found in moist meadows, woodland edges, and along streambanks, where it thrives in partial shade to full sun.
